section_title: Officer Commissions in the Army, &c. may be issued without Her Majesty’s Royal Sign Manual being affixed thereto.
section_text: 1 It shall be lawful for Her Majesty, by Order in Council, from time to time, as occasion may require, to direct  as regards all or any of Her Majesty’s naval, military or air forces  that all or any commissions for officers prepared or to be prepared under the authority of Her Majesty’s Royal Sign Manual may be afterwards issued without Her Royal Sign Manual, but  having thereon the signature of a Secretary of State and, if the order so provides, of a member or members of the Defence Council ; and every such commission issued and signed in pursuance of such Order in Council shall be conclusive evidence that the officer named in any such commission has been appointed or promoted by Her Majesty to the rank or office named therein.

section_title: Nothing to affect Her Majesty’s Right to sign Commissions.
section_text: 2 Nothing herein contained shall be construed to prevent Her Majesty from signing any commission, or to prevent any commission so signed from having the same validity and effect as if this Act had not passed.
